H0.text: Eating raw vegetables is the most likely cause of strep throat in a patient presenting with a red and swollen throat.

H1.text: Drinking lemonade is the most likely cause of strep throat infection characterized by a red and swollen throat.

H2.text: Invading bacteria are the most likely cause of strep throat, which presents with a red and swollen throat.

H3.text: Running in cold weather is the most likely cause of strep throat, given that the symptoms are a red and swollen throat.

A4.text: S. pyogenes causes pharyngitis which is also known as strep throat.

A5.text: S. pyogenes infections are commonly associated with the release of one or more bacterial toxins. The release of endotoxins from throat infections has been linked to the development of scarlet fever which can lead to rheumatic fever.
